instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> minimal liquid spill, now not seeing SSD and sometimes no WiFi
threads.message:
Hi, got a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> here that had a tiny liquid spill.

Now it doesn't see the SSD, neither in partition selection nor in disk utility.
Also, most of the time WiFi will not work, but sometimes it does.

The spill was in between the WiFi/BT module and the SSD connector. But it was tiny and did not leave any corrosion behind after cleaning.

All power rails on the SSD connector are present. I am guessing some kind of PCIE signal, but I have no idea about those. Kind of stuck here.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> minimal liquid spill, now not seeing SSD and sometimes no WiFi
threads.message: No idea, got a picture of the affected area?
